content.name: Rule 8.6: linker script defined symbols
content.text: It is safe to declare this symbol because it is defined in the linker script.

content.name: Rule 8.4: asm-only definition
content.text: Functions and variables used only by asm modules do not need to have a visible declaration prior to their definition.

content.name: MC3A2.R10.1: use of an enumeration constant in an arithmetic operation
content.text: This violation can be fixed with a cast to (int) of the enumeration constant, but a deviation was chosen due to code readability (see also the comment in BITS_TO_LONGS).

content.name: MC3A2.R20.4: allow the definition of a macro with the same name as a keyword in some special cases
content.text: The definition of a macro with the same name as a keyword can be useful in certain configurations to improve the guarantees that can be provided by Xen. See docs/misra/deviations.rst for a precise rationale for all such cases.

content.name: Rule 17.1: internal helper functions made to break long running hypercalls into multiple calls.
content.text: They need to take a variable number of arguments depending on the original hypercall they are trying to continue.

content.name: MC3A2.R16.2: using a case label when the most closely-enclosing compound statement is not a switch statement
content.text: A switch label enclosed by some compound statement that is not the body of a switch is permitted within local helper macros that are unlikely to be misused or misunderstood.

content.name: MC3A2.R20.12: use of a macro argument that deliberately violates the Rule
content.text: A macro parameter that is itself a macro is intentionally used within the macro both as a regular parameter and for text replacement.

content.name: MC3A2.R20.7: deliberately non-parenthesized macro argument
content.text: A macro parameter expands to an expression that is non-parenthesized, as doing so would break the functionality.

content.name: Dir 4.10: headers that leave it up to the caller to include them correctly
content.text: Headers that deliberatively leave the responsability of their correct inclusion to the caller are allowed.

content.name: Dir 4.10: empty headers
content.text: Empty headers pose no risk if included more than once.

content.name: Dir 4.10: direct inclusion guard before
content.text: Headers with just the direct inclusion guard before the inclusion guard are safe.

content.name: Rule 16.6: single clause due to kconfig
content.text: A switch statement with a single switch clause because other switch clauses are disabled in a given kconfig is safe.

content.name: Rule 16.6: single clause due to future expansion
content.text: A switch statement with a single switch clause to purposely enable future additions of new cases is safe.
